analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //

original: don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
analyzed: don chen yi ge dam pa yin //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don che ba dang yi ge dam pa yin pas kun rdzob tu don dam pa'i bden pa brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: khong nas 'byung ba ni khyab pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: skye ba med pa ni stong pa nyid du brjod pa'o //

original: bya ba nan tan grub pa'i /
analyzed: bya ba nan tan grub pa'i /
translated: Action is the accomplishment of activities.

original: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //

analyzed: mchod pa che zhes bya ba ni mchod pa chen pos dbugs 'byin pa ste /

original: de nyid ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni /

analyzed: de nyid ni /

analyzed: gti mug blo ste gti mug sel //

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chags pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir chags pa che ba'o //

analyzed: byams pa'i sbyin pas thams cad du snyan par grags pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi 'khor gsungs pa ni shes rab mtshon chen zhes bya ste /

original: nyon mongs gcod pa'i shes rab ni //
analyzed: nyon mongs gcod pa'i shes rab ni //

analyzed: nyon mongs lcags kyu che ba'i mchog ni rdo rje rnon po sku mdog sngon po po ti dang ral gri 'chang ba'o //

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi shes rab ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi shes rab ni /
translated: The wisdom of supernatural power is

analyzed: rdo rje gsung ba zangs ma'i mdog can phyag g-yas pa rdo rje bsnams shing g-yon pa gdan la brten pa'o //

analyzed: rdo rje srung ba sku mdog ser po phyag na go cha bsnams pa'o //

translated: The one who is the magical emanation of the striving of practice of the great magic is Vajra-Fist, yellow in color, holding a vajra with his two hands crossed in the vajra-binding gesture, like a myrobalan fruit placed in the palm of the hand.

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i mchog ni tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin phreng ba ma ser mo phyag gnyis kyis rin po che'i phreng ba bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i mchog ni tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin phreng ba ma ser mo phyag gnyis kyis rin po che'i phreng ba bsnams pa'o //
translated: The supreme holder of great morality is the nature of morality, the yellow Garland Bearer, holding a jewel garland with both hands.

original: bzod chen 'chang ba brtan pa po ni bzod pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje glu ma dmar mo phyag gnyis pi wang brdung ba'o //
analyzed: bzod chen 'chang ba brtan pa po ni bzod pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje glu ma dmar mo phyag gnyis pi wang brdung ba'o //
translated: The patient one who holds great patience is the nature of patience, the red Vajra Songstress, playing a lute with both hands.

original: brtson 'grus chen po brtul ba yin ni brtson 'grus rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje gar ma ljang gu phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje bsnams te gar byed pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po brtul ba yin ni brtson 'grus rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje gar ma ljang gu phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje bsnams te gar byed pa'o //
translated: The one who is the great effort of striving is the nature of pure effort, the green Vajra Dancer, holding a vajra with both hands and dancing.

original: nang gi phyogs kyi mtshams la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi phyogs kyi mtshams la gnas pa'o //
translated: They abide in the inner cardinal and intermediate directions.

original: yang phyi'i mtshams la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: yang phyi'i mtshams la gnas pa ni /
translated: Again, abiding in the outer intermediate directions,

original: bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas //
analyzed: bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas //
translated: Great meditation, the state of samadhi,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: bsam gtan chen po ni zhi gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan chen po ni zhi gnas so //

original: ting 'dzin gnas pa ni zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ting 'dzin gnas pa ni zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The state of samadhi is union.

original: bsam @8b gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje bdug pa ma sku mdog dkar mo phyag gnyis kyis spos khang bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: bsam @8b gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje bdug pa ma sku mdog dkar mo phyag gnyis kyis spos khang bsnams pa'o //

analyzed: shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin me tog gi snod bsnams pa'o //

original: stobs po che la thabs che ba ni stobs dang thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje mar me ma dmar mo phyag gnyis na mar me'i mchod sdong bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: stobs po che la thabs che ba ni stobs dang thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje mar me ma dmar mo phyag gnyis na mar me'i mchod sdong bsnams pa'o //
translated: Great strength, great means, red Vajra Lamp Lady, the nature of the perfections of strength and means, holds a lamp in her two hands.

original: smon lam ye shes rgya mtsho ste ni smon lam dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin dri chab ma ljang gu dri'i dung chos bsnams nas 'thor ba'o //
analyzed: smon lam ye shes rgya mtsho ste ni smon lam dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin dri chab ma ljang gu dri'i dung chos bsnams nas 'thor ba'o //
translated: The one called ‚ÄúVows, Ocean of Intuition‚Äù is green Gandhahastin, the nature of the Perfection of Vows and Intuition, holding a perfume conch and sprinkling.

original: bskal pa bzang po'i gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po'i gsungs pa ni /
translated: The one called ‚ÄúGood Aeon‚Äù is

original: byams chen rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byams chen rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the one called ‚ÄúGreat Love‚Äù and so on.

original: ji lta ba'i ming bzhin du don dang ldan pas na byams pa'o //üîΩblo'i mchog gi snying rje chen po dang ldan pas 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: ji lta ba'i ming bzhin du don dang ldan pas na byams pa'o // blo'i mchog gi snying rje chen po dang ldan pas 'jam dpal lo //
translated: He is ‚ÄúLove‚Äù because he has a meaning that accords with his name.üîΩHe is ‚ÄúGentle Splendor‚Äù because he has great compassion, the best of minds.

original: shes rab chen po'i blo snying rje chen po dang ldan pas spos kyi glang po'o //
analyzed: shes rab chen po'i blo snying rje chen po dang ldan pas spos kyi glang po'o //
translated: He is ‚ÄúGreat Elephant of Incense‚Äù because he has great compassion, the mind of great wisdom.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs chen po dang mkhas pa'i byed pa chen po dang ldan pas ye shes tog go //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs chen po dang mkhas pa'i byed pa chen po dang ldan pas ye shes tog go //
translated: He is ‚ÄúBanner of Intuition‚Äù because he has the skill of the great means of the abundance of intuition and the great activity of skill.

original: mi bskyod pa'i 'khor te thams cad kyang mdog dkar po rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa shar phyogs na bzhugs so //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i 'khor te thams cad kyang mdog dkar po rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa shar phyogs na bzhugs so //
translated: The retinue of Ak·π£hobhya is all white in color, holding a vajra and a bell, and they reside in the east.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po stobs chen ldan //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po stobs chen ldan //
translated: He has great magical power and great strength.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sems can thams cad skyob pas na bzang skyong ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sems can thams cad skyob pas na bzang skyong ngo //
translated: He is called BhadrapƒÅla because he protects all sentient beings by the power of his magical creations.

original: rgya mtsho chen po bzhin du shugs kyis blo che zhing mgyogs pa che bas blo gros rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po bzhin du shugs kyis blo che zhing mgyogs pa che bas blo gros rgya mtsho'o //
translated: He is called SƒÅgaramati because his mind is vast and swift like the great ocean.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po'i mthu ni ye shes phun sum tshogs ba cher grags pa mi zad pas na blo gros mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po'i mthu ni ye shes phun sum tshogs ba cher grags pa mi zad pas na blo gros mi zad pa'o //
translated: He is called Ak·π£ayamati because his great perfection of wisdom is renowned as inexhaustible.

original: stobs chen pha rol gnon pa ni spobs pa'i stobs kyis pha rol pos gzhig par mi nus pas na spobs pa brtsegs pa'o //
analyzed: stobs chen pha rol gnon pa ni spobs pa'i stobs kyis pha rol pos gzhig par mi nus pas na spobs pa brtsegs pa'o //
translated: He is called PratibhƒÅnak≈´·π≠a because his strength of eloquence cannot be destroyed by others.

original: thams cad kyang ser po rin po che dang dril bu bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang ser po rin po che dang dril bu bsnams pa'o //
translated: All of them are yellow, holding jewels and bells.

original: thams cad kyang lho'i phyogs su bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang lho'i phyogs su bzhugs pa'o //
translated: All of them reside in the south.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi 'khor ro //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi 'khor ro //
translated: They are the retinue of Ratnasa·πÉbhava.

original: rang gi stobs kyis srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms par mdzad pas mthu chen po thob pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi stobs kyis srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms par mdzad pas mthu chen po thob pa'o //
translated: He is called MahƒÅmati because he has attained great power, which destroys the great mountain of existence by its own strength.

original: srid pa'i gzeb mkhregs shing ngan song du 'gro ba 'dzin cing 'dren pas na /
analyzed: srid pa'i gzeb mkhregs shing ngan song du 'gro ba 'dzin cing 'dren pas na /
translated: He is the great mountain of existence, because he is the great mountain of the three realms.üîΩHe is the destroyer of the great mountain of existence,

original: srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms //
analyzed: srid pa'i ri bo chen po 'joms //
translated: because he destroys the hard cage of existence.

original: zhes bya'o // la las /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // la las /
translated: Some say:

original: mkhregs shing rdo rje chen po @9a * //
analyzed: mkhregs shing rdo rje chen po @9a * //

analyzed: 'chang ; / zhes bya ba ni gzhig par dka' zhing mkhregs pa'i ngan song 'dren pas na ngan song kun 'dren no // 'khor ba'i nyes pas ma gos pa'i phyir drag po chen po ste mi shes pa'i mun pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /

original: drag shul che ba la mya ngan dang mun pa nges par 'joms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: drag shul che ba la mya ngan dang mun pa nges par 'joms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is the destroyer of sorrow and darkness, because he is the antidote to the darkness of nescience.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad kyi mthu'i 'od zer gyis 'jigs pa sel bas na /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad kyi mthu'i 'od zer gyis 'jigs pa sel bas na /
translated: He is the great fear of the fearful, because he removes fear with the light of the power of all fears.

original: 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa ste dra ba can gyi 'od do //
analyzed: 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa ste dra ba can gyi 'od do //
translated: He is the fearful one of the fearful, because he is the light of the net.

original: thams cad kyang dmar po padma dang dril bu bsnams pa nub phyogs su bzhugs pa snang ba mtha' yas kyi 'khor ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang dmar po padma dang dril bu bsnams pa nub phyogs su bzhugs pa snang ba mtha' yas kyi 'khor ro //
translated: All of them are red, hold lotuses and bells, and stand in the west. They are the retinue of Amitabha.

original: rig pa rnam pa gsum gyis tshim pas sems can skar ma lta bu'i mgon byed pas na mgon po rigs mchog chen po ste zla 'od gzhon nu'o //
analyzed: rig pa rnam pa gsum gyis tshim pas sems can skar ma lta bu'i mgon byed pas na mgon po rigs mchog chen po ste zla 'od gzhon nu'o //

original: bla ma gsang sngags che ba'i mchog / ces bya ba ni gsung gi bdag po 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma gsang sngags che ba'i mchog / ces bya ba ni gsung gi bdag po 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The one called guru, the supreme of great mantras, is AmitƒÅbha, the lord of speech.

original: theg pa chen po spros pa med pa nam mkha'i tshul la gnas shing skyes pas nam mkha'i snying po'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po spros pa med pa nam mkha'i tshul la gnas shing skyes pas nam mkha'i snying po'o //
translated: Since he is born abiding in the manner of space, the mode of the unelaborated MahƒÅyƒÅna, he is ƒÄkƒÅ≈õagarbha.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis sgrib pa thams cad 'gegs pa'i mchog yin pas na sgrib pa rnam par sel ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis sgrib pa thams cad 'gegs pa'i mchog yin pas na sgrib pa rnam par sel ba'o //
translated: Since he is the supreme obstruction-stopper by the method of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, he is Sarvanƒ´vara·πáavi·π£kambhin.

original: thams cad kyang sku mdog ljang gu sna tshogs rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa byang phyogs su bzhugs pa don yod grub pa'i 'khor ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang sku mdog ljang gu sna tshogs rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa byang phyogs su bzhugs pa don yod grub pa'i 'khor ro //
translated: All of them have green-colored bodies, hold various vajras and bells, and reside in the north. They are the retinue of Amoghasiddhi.

original: sgo ba ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgo ba ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The gatekeepers will be explained later.

original: de ltar shlo ka bcu bzhi pa ni aa ra pa tsa na'i bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor ro /
analyzed: de ltar shlo ka bcu bzhi pa ni aa ra pa tsa na'i bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor ro /
translated: Thus, the fourteenth verse is the mandala of the vajra realm of Vajrasattva, the universal monarch, who is the nature of the Arhat.

original: // / rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbang du byas na /üîΩsangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che //
analyzed: // / rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbang du byas na / sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad che //
translated: With regard to the mandala of Vairochana,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúthe great Buddha Vairochana.‚Äù

original: rnam par snang mdzad nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad nyid do //

original: thub pa chen po ni rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba med pas stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin rdo rje sems ma'o //
analyzed: thub pa chen po ni rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba med pas stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin rdo rje sems ma'o //
translated: The great sage is the vajra mind of emptiness, because he is without the distraction of conceptualization.

original: lus ngag yid gsum gyi thug pa chen po dang ldan pas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdo rje rin chen ma'o //
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum gyi thug pa chen po dang ldan pas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdo rje rin chen ma'o //
translated: Endowed with the great seal of body, speech, and mind, he is the vajra gem of the samƒÅdhi of signlessness.

original: gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba ni so sor rtog pa'i smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las byung ba rdo rje chos ma'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba ni so sor rtog pa'i smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las byung ba rdo rje chos ma'o //
translated: Arisen from the great way of mantra, he is the vajra dharma arisen from the samƒÅdhi of the wishlessness of discernment.

original: bya ba nan tan grub pas 'od gsal bar byed pas na /
analyzed: bya ba nan tan grub pas 'od gsal bar byed pas na /
translated: He illuminates through the accomplishment of the performance of activities.

original: gsang sngags tshul can bdag nyid can te rdo rje las ma'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul can bdag nyid can te rdo rje las ma'o //
translated: He is the Vajra Karma, the one who has the nature of the Mantra way.

original: pha rol phyin bcu thob pa ste //
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu thob pa ste //
translated: He is surrounded by the ten perfections.

original: zhes bya ba bcu rnam par dag pa'i lha @9b mo rang dang 'dra ba'i sku mdog dang phyag mtshan gyi dbyibs dang ldan pas bskor ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' ste /

analyzed: byang chub sems bzang po pha rol tu phyin pa bcus yongs su bskor ba'i phyir ro //

original: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas //

original: pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //

original: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus yongs su bskor ba'i rdo rje chags pa'o //

analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu yi tshul //

original: mgon po sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste //
analyzed: mgon po sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste //
translated: The ten transcendences are

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha mo bcus yongs su bskor ba'i rdo rje rin chen ste sa bcu'i lam gyi bdag nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ltung ba phra mo'i kun du spyod pa dang bral bas mi 'jigs pa ste snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus bskor ba ni
translated: This is Vajraratna, surrounded by ten goddesses, who is fearless, since he is free from the practice of even the slightest downfall, because he is established in the nature of the path of the ten stages.

original: rdo rje nyi ma'o //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma'o //
translated: Vajras≈´rya is surrounded by ten goddesses, as before.

original: bden pa bzhi shes pa dang chos dang rjes su shes pa dag dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa shes pa dag dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni shes pa bcu pa ste /

translated: The ten knowledges are the knowledge of the four truths, the knowledge of phenomena and subsequent knowledge, the knowledge of the conventional and ultimate, and the knowledge of elimination and nonarising.

translated: Vajradhvaja is surrounded by ten goddesses, as before, since the purification of those knowledges is the nature of love that focuses on sentient beings.

original: shes pa bcu dang mthun pa'i chos kyi sbyor ba dang rang bzhin rnam par dag pa 'chang ba po ni snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus bskor ba'i rdo rje bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa bcu dang mthun pa'i chos kyi sbyor ba dang rang bzhin rnam par dag pa 'chang ba po ni snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus bskor ba'i rdo rje bzhad pa'o //
translated: The one who holds the ten knowledges, the application of the Dharma, and the pure nature, is Vajra Smile, surrounded by the ten goddesses as before.

original: phung po khams dang skye mched dang rten 'brel dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / bdag dang dus gsum dang bden pa bzhi dang / theg pa gsum dang 'dus @10a * //
analyzed: phung po khams dang skye mched dang rten 'brel dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / bdag dang dus gsum dang bden pa bzhi dang / theg pa gsum dang 'dus @10a * //
translated: The ten knowledges are the knowledge of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, the possible and impossible, the self and the three times, the four noble truths, the three vehicles, and the compounded and uncompounded.

original: byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi bdag nyid la mkhas pa gcig pu dang / za ba la sogs pa'i gnyen po rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi bdag nyid la mkhas pa gcig pu dang / za ba la sogs pa'i gnyen po rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: The single knowledge of these is the antidote to the ten, such as eating.

original: de nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen po ni zhi gnas gnyen po'i yan lag ting nge 'dzin gyi shes rab rdo rje chos ni rnam pa bcu'i lha mos bskor ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen po ni zhi gnas gnyen po'i yan lag ting nge 'dzin gyi shes rab rdo rje chos ni rnam pa bcu'i lha mos bskor ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Vajra Dharma, the wisdom of concentration, the branch of the antidote of shamatha, is the antidote to the grasping of self, surrounded by the ten goddesses as before.

original: mkhas pa bcu'i spang bya bcu ni gcig pu dang / rgyu dang / zab pa dang / byed pa dang / dbang dang ldan pa dang / bdag po dang / rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang / sgom pa po dang /
analyzed: mkhas pa bcu'i spang bya bcu ni gcig pu dang / rgyu dang / zab pa dang / byed pa dang / dbang dang ldan pa dang / bdag po dang / rtog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang / sgom pa po dang /
translated: The ten objects of abandonment of the ten wise ones are the ten apprehensions of singularity, cause, profundity, action, power, master, conception, thorough affliction and complete purification, meditator,

original: bcings pa dang grol ba dag tu 'dzin pa bcu'o //
analyzed: bcings pa dang grol ba dag tu 'dzin pa bcu'o //
translated: and bondage and liberation.

original: de dag gcod pa'i lhag mthong gi bdag nyid tshol ba'i nyon mongs pa gcod pa'i rdo rje rnon po ste snga ma bzhin lha mo bcus yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gcod pa'i lhag mthong gi bdag nyid tshol ba'i nyon mongs pa gcod pa'i rdo rje rnon po ste snga ma bzhin lha mo bcus yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The ten goddesses are the ten vajra sharpnesses that cut those, which have the nature of insight, and cut the afflictions that are sought.

original: thub dbang zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i don te sha la sogs pa'i spyan lnga dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i mthu thob pas na thub pa'i dbang po bdag nyid ni rdo rje 'khor lo ste snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus bskor ba'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi stobs bcu'i rang
analyzed: thub dbang zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i don te sha la sogs pa'i spyan lnga dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i mthu thob pas na thub pa'i dbang po bdag nyid ni rdo rje 'khor lo ste snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus bskor ba'i so so yang dag par rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi stobs bcu'i rang
translated: The one called ‚ÄúLord of Sages‚Äù is the object of the sense faculties, the five eyes such as the fleshly eye, and the five faculties such as faith.üîΩThe one who is the Lord of Sages, the nature of the vajra wheel, is the nature of the ten powers, the nature of the four correct and discerning awarenesses, surrounded by the ten goddesses as before.üîΩThe one who is the nature of the vajra speech is the nature of the ten powers, the nature of the four correct and discerning awarenesses, surrounded by the ten goddesses as before.

original: bzhin rdo rje gsung ba'o //
analyzed: bzhin rdo rje gsung ba'o //
translated: The one who is the nature of the vajra mind is the nature of the ten powers, the nature of the four correct and discerning awarenesses, surrounded by the ten goddesses as before.üîΩThe one who is the nature of the vajra quality is the nature of the ten powers, the nature of the four correct and discerning awarenesses, surrounded by the ten goddesses as before.

original: snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The one who is the nature of the vajra action is the nature of the ten powers, the nature of the four correct and discerning awarenesses, surrounded by the ten goddesses as before.üîΩThe one who is the nature of the vajra wheel is the nature of the ten powers, the nature of the four correct and discerning awarenesses, surrounded by the ten goddesses as before.üîΩThe one who is the nature of the vajra speech is the nature of the ten powers, the nature of the four correct and discerning awarenesses, surrounded by the ten goddesses as before.

original: khyab pa'i bdag nyid ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad kyi steng du nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa'i zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bcu dang ldan pas sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la 'jug pa ni rdo rje las soüîΩ// snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: khyab pa'i bdag nyid ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad kyi steng du nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa'i zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bcu dang ldan pas sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la 'jug pa ni rdo rje las soüîΩ// snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The one who is the nature of the vajra mind is the nature of the ten powers, the nature of the four correct and discerning awarenesses, surrounded by the ten goddesses as before.

original: kun gyi don ni ma lus byed //
analyzed: kun gyi don ni ma lus byed //
translated: He performs all the aims of all.

original: ces bya ba ni zad par bcu ston pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni zad par bcu ston pa yin te /
translated: This shows the ten totalities.

original: don sna tshogs pa mdzad pas sgrub par byed pa'i brtson 'grus ni srung ba ste /
analyzed: don sna tshogs pa mdzad pas sgrub par byed pa'i brtson 'grus ni srung ba ste /
translated: The effort that accomplishes the various aims is the protection.

original: snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus bskor ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus bskor ba'o //
translated: As before, he is surrounded by ten goddesses.

original: rnam pa bcu ni de kho na nyid bcu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ni de kho na nyid bcu ste /
translated: The ten aspects are the ten realities.

original: rtsa ba dang / mtshan nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / rgyu 'bras dang / phra mo dang ; rgya che ba dang / grub pa dang / grub pa'i yul dang / bsdu ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / mkhas pa de kho na nyid de so sor rtog pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa bcu dang ldan pas rdo rje gnod sbyin te /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang / mtshan nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / rgyu 'bras dang / phra mo dang ; rgya che ba dang / grub pa dang / grub pa'i yul dang / bsdu ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / mkhas pa de kho na nyid de so sor rtog pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa bcu dang ldan pas rdo rje gnod sbyin te /
translated: The vajra-yak·π£a is endowed with ten kinds of application to discernment, namely, the realities of root, characteristic, non-error, cause and effect, subtlety, vastness, accomplishment, the domain of accomplishment, collection, retention, and expertise.

original: snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus bskor ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus bskor ba'o //
translated: As before, he is surrounded by ten goddesses.

original: dbang ldan che ba po ni dbang bcus te sgrub pa nan tan du byed @10b ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pas rdo rje khu tshur yang snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus bskor ba'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan che ba po ni dbang bcus te sgrub pa nan tan du byed @10b ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pas rdo rje khu tshur yang snga ma bzhin du lha mo bcus bskor ba'o //
translated: The powerful Mahe≈õvara is surrounded by ten goddesses, just as VajrapƒÅ·πái was, because he is intent on practice, being endowed with the ten powers.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩlha rnams ji ltar rigs par ni //
analyzed: de skad du yang / lha rnams ji ltar rigs par ni //
translated: And so it is said:üîΩThe gods are surrounded by ten qualities,

original: yon tan bcu yis yongs su bskor //
analyzed: yon tan bcu yis yongs su bskor //
translated: in accordance with their respective positions.

original: de yi lha mo bcu po ni //
analyzed: de yi lha mo bcu po ni //
translated: The ten goddesses of that

original: rdo rje skyil krung phyed pas bzhugs //üîΩzhes gsungs so /
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung phyed pas bzhugs // zhes gsungs so /
translated: sit in half-vajra posture.

original: // / da ni tshigs su bcad pa brgyad kyis rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa de nyid bstan pa ni thog ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: // / da ni tshigs su bcad pa brgyad kyis rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa de nyid bstan pa ni thog ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in eight verses, the reality of Vajrasattva and so on is taught, beginning with the line, ‚ÄúWithout beginning or end.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: The mirror-like intuition is the transformation of the fundamental consciousness.

original: spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid ni spros pa mi mnyam pa yin la spros pa med pas na mnyam pa nyid do ;
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid ni spros pa mi mnyam pa yin la spros pa med pas na mnyam pa nyid do ;
translated: The nature of non-elaboration is the equality of non-differentiation of elaboration.

original: / de bzhin nyid dag ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa dang / dag pa'i bdag ni dri ma med pa'i bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin nyid dag ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa dang / dag pa'i bdag ni dri ma med pa'i bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The suchness is the natural purity. The pure self is the stainless self, Vajrasattva.

original: bden par smra zhing ni so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bden par smra zhing ni so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Speaking the truth is the discriminating wisdom.

original: tshig mi 'gyur ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshig mi 'gyur ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The unchanging word is the equality.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed ni me long lta bu dang bya ba nan tan grub ba ste rdo rje rgyal po'o ;
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed ni me long lta bu dang bya ba nan tan grub ba ste rdo rje rgyal po'o ;
translated: The one who acts in accordance with his words is the mirror-like wisdom and the successful action, Vajraraja.

original: / gnyis med ces pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: / gnyis med ces pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: The non-dual is the mirror-like wisdom free from the subject-object dichotomy.

original: gnyis su med pa rtog pa ni so sor kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa rtog pa ni so sor kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: The non-dual thought is the discriminating wisdom.

original: bya ba nan tan grub pa'i yang dag pa'i mtha' las rnam par gnas pa mnyam pa nyid de rdo rje chags pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba nan tan grub pa'i yang dag pa'i mtha' las rnam par gnas pa mnyam pa nyid de rdo rje chags pa'o //
translated: The successful action is the equality which is based on the reality limit, Vajraraga.

original: bdag med seng ge'i sgra dang ldan pa ni me long lta bu ste /
analyzed: bdag med seng ge'i sgra dang ldan pa ni me long lta bu ste /
translated: The one who has the lion-roar of selflessness is the mirror-like wisdom.

original: mdo sde rgyan las kyang /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan las kyang /
translated: In the Sutralamkara it is said:

original: me long lta bu bdag med pa //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: me long lta bu bdag med pa //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: The mirror-like is selfless.

original: so sor rtog pa dang bya ba nan tan grub pas /üîΩmu stegs ri dags ngan 'jigs byed pa ste rdo rje legs pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa dang bya ba nan tan grub pas / mu stegs ri dags ngan 'jigs byed pa ste rdo rje legs pa'o //
translated: The two, discrimination and dutyfulfillment,üîΩare the one called VajrasƒÅdhu, who terrifies the evil beasts of the tƒ´rthikas.üîΩ

original: kun du 'gro ba ni me long lta bu'o //üîΩde skad du yang me long lta bu ni bdag med pa yongs su chad pa med pa rtag tu 'gro'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba ni me long lta bu'o // de skad du yang me long lta bu ni bdag med pa yongs su chad pa med pa rtag tu 'gro'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The mirror-like one is the victor, because it is the fruit of separation.

original: chos thams cad la mnyam par 'jug pas don yod par 'gro bas mnyam pa nyid do //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa'i yid ltar mgyogs //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mnyam par 'jug pas don yod par 'gro bas mnyam pa nyid do // de bzhin gshegs pa'i yid ltar mgyogs //
translated: The equality one is the universal conqueror, because it is the fruit of universal conquest.üîΩThe one of thorough discernment is the king of the swans, because it is the king of the birds.üîΩThe one of successful activity is the great elephant, because it is the king of animals.

original: zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa dang bya ba nan tan dang ldan pa ste rdo rje rin chen no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa dang bya ba nan tan dang ldan pa ste rdo rje rin chen no //
translated: The one of universal commitment is the great vajra, because it is the king of gems.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rgyal ba ni me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rgyal ba ni me long lta bu'o //
translated: The mirror-like one is the victor, because it is the fruit of separation.

original: rnam rgyal dgra las rgyal ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas mnyam pa nyid do //üîΩrang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas so sor kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam rgyal dgra las rgyal ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas mnyam pa nyid do // rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas so sor kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: The equality one is the universal conqueror, because it is the fruit of universal conquest.üîΩThe one of thorough discernment is the king of the swans, because it is the king of the birds.üîΩThe one of successful activity is the great elephant, because it is the king of animals.üîΩThe one of universal commitment is the great vajra, because it is the king of gems.üîΩThe mirror-like one is the universal monarch, because it is the king of wheels.üîΩThe equality one is the great hero, because it is the king of men.üîΩThe one of thorough discernment is the king of swans, because it is the king of birds.

original: 'khor los sgyur rgyal stobs po che //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur rgyal stobs po che //
translated: The one of successful activity is the great elephant, because it is the king of animals.üîΩThe one of universal commitment is the great vajra, because it is the king of gems.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo dang ngo bo'i bya ba nan tan grub pa ste rdo rje nyi ma'o //üîΩye shes @11a * //üîΩkun gyi rten yin pa'i phyir /üîΩtshogs kyi slob dpon tshogs kyi bdag ste me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo dang ngo bo'i bya ba nan tan grub pa ste rdo rje nyi ma'o // ye shes @11a * // kun gyi rten yin pa'i phyir / tshogs kyi slob dpon tshogs kyi bdag ste me long lta bu'o //
translated: The activity of the wheel and the essence is the accomplishment of deeds, which is the vajra sun.üîΩThe lord of the assembly is the mirror-like gnosis.

original: tshogs rje ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshogs rje ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The master of the assembly is the gnosis of equality.

original: tshogs bdag ni so sor kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs bdag ni so sor kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: The owner of the assembly is the individually discerning gnosis.

original: dpal dang ldan pa ni bya ba nan tan te rdo rje rgyal mtshan no //
analyzed: dpal dang ldan pa ni bya ba nan tan te rdo rje rgyal mtshan no //
translated: The glorious one is the gnosis of successful activities, which is the vajra victory banner.

original: mthu chen ni me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: mthu chen ni me long lta bu'o //
translated: The one with great power is the mirror-like gnosis.

original: gces par 'dzin pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: gces par 'dzin pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The one who cherishes is the gnosis of equality.

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog ni so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog ni so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The one who does not depend on others is the individually discerning gnosis.

original: tshul chen ni theg pa gsum la 'jug pas na bya ba grub pa ste rdo rje bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: tshul chen ni theg pa gsum la 'jug pas na bya ba grub pa ste rdo rje bzhad pa'o //
translated: The one with great method is the gnosis of successful activities, which is the vajra smile.

original: tshig rje ni me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshig rje ni me long lta bu'o //
translated: The lord of speech is the mirror-like gnosis.

original: tshig bdag ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshig bdag ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The owner of speech is the gnosis of equality.

original: smra mkhas pa ni so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: smra mkhas pa ni so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The one skilled in speech is the individually discerning gnosis.

original: tshig la dbang ba ni bya ba grub pa'o //
analyzed: tshig la dbang ba ni bya ba grub pa'o //
translated: The one with power over speech is the gnosis of successful activities.

original: tshig mtha' yas ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rdo rje chos so //
analyzed: tshig mtha' yas ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rdo rje chos so //
translated: Endless words is the wisdom of the realm of phenomena, Vajradharma.

original: tshig bden pa ni so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: tshig bden pa ni so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Truthful words is discerning wisdom.

original: bden par smra ba ni me long lta bu mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: bden par smra ba ni me long lta bu mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Truth-speaking is the mirror-like equanimity.

original: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po ni bya ba grub ba ste rdo rje rnon po'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po ni bya ba grub ba ste rdo rje rnon po'o //
translated: The teacher of the four truths is all-accomplishing wisdom, Vajra-tikshna.

original: phyir mi ldog pa ste btags pas na me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ste btags pas na me long lta bu'o //
translated: The irreversible one is the mirror-like one.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni thogs pa med pas na mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni thogs pa med pas na mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The non-returner is the equanimity of unobstructedness.

original: bse ru'i tshul ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir so sor kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bse ru'i tshul ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir so sor kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: The rhinoceros-like one is the discerning one, because it is not shared.

original: so so'i 'khor rnams 'dren pas na bya ba nan tan te rdo rje 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: so so'i 'khor rnams 'dren pas na bya ba nan tan te rdo rje 'khor lo'o //
translated: The leader of the individual retinues is the all-accomplishing one, Vajra-cakra.

original: des 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba ni so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: des 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba ni so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The one arisen from various elements is the discerning one.

original: 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig pa ni bya ba nan tan te rdo rje srung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig pa ni bya ba nan tan te rdo rje srung ba'o //
translated: The one with the single cause of the great elements is the all-accomplishing one, Vajra-varman.

original: dgra bcom zag pa zad ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa zad pas na me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom zag pa zad ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa zad pas na me long lta bu'o //
translated: The arhat who has exhausted the defilements is like a mirror, because he has exhausted the obscurations of the defilements and the knowable.

original: dge slong ni bya ba nan tan to //
analyzed: dge slong ni bya ba nan tan to //
translated: The monk is like the diamond of action, because he is intent on action.

original: 'dod chags bral ba ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral ba ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The one free from attachment is like equality, because he is intent on equality.

original: dbang po thul ni so sor rtog pa ste rdo rje las so //
analyzed: dbang po thul ni so sor rtog pa ste rdo rje las so //
translated: The one who has subdued the faculties is like the diamond of discernment, because he is intent on discernment.

original: bde bar rnyed pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: bde bar rnyed pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The one who has attained happiness is like equality, because he is intent on equality.

original: 'jigs med thob pa ni spong ba phun sum tshogs pa ste me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'jigs med thob pa ni spong ba phun sum tshogs pa ste me long lta bu'o //
translated: The one who has attained fearlessness is like the mirror, because he is intent on the perfection of abandonment.

original: bsil bar gyur pa ni so sor kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bsil bar gyur pa ni so sor kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: The one who has become cool is like discernment, because he is intent on discernment.

original: rnyog pa med pa ni rnyog pa med par byed pa ste bya ba nan tan te rdo rje srung ba'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa ni rnyog pa med par byed pa ste bya ba nan tan te rdo rje srung ba'o //
translated: The one who is free from turbidity is like the diamond of action, because he is intent on the action of removing turbidity.

original: rig pa dang ni rkang par ldan //
analyzed: rig pa dang ni rkang par ldan //
translated: He is endowed with knowledge and feet.

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa ste me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa ste me long lta bu'o //
translated: Knowledge is like the mirror, because it is omniscience.

original: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu mi gnas pas na mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu mi gnas pas na mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The one who has gone to bliss is like equality, because he is intent on non-abiding.

original: 'jig rten rig pa ni so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa ni so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The one who knows the world is like discernment, because he is intent on discernment.

original: mchog ni rdo rje gnod sbyin te bya ba nan tan to //üîΩbdag gir mi 'dzin ni me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: mchog ni rdo rje gnod sbyin te bya ba nan tan to // bdag gir mi 'dzin ni me long lta bu'o //
translated: The best is Vajrayak·π£a, the performance is the steadfast one.üîΩNot grasping as mine is the mirror-like one.

original: ngar mi 'dzin ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: ngar mi 'dzin ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Not grasping as I is the one of equality.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
translated: Abiding in the mode of the two truths

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam pa la gnas pa so @11b sor rtog pa dang / kun rdzob la gnas pa bya ba nan tan te rdo rje khu tshur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam pa la gnas pa so @11b sor rtog pa dang / kun rdzob la gnas pa bya ba nan tan te rdo rje khu tshur ro //
translated: This means that the steadfast one in the ultimate is the discerning one, and the steadfast one in the conventional is the steadfast one, the vajra fist.

original: 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa //
translated: Having gone to the end of the far shore of cyclic existence

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig rkang bcu drug gis bskal ba bzang po rnams bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig rkang bcu drug gis bskal ba bzang po rnams bstan to //
translated: and so on, with sixteen lines, the good eons are taught.

original: 'khor ba'i sems can pha rol thams cad kyi mthar byams pas ston pas na byams pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sems can pha rol thams cad kyi mthar byams pas ston pas na byams pa'o //
translated: Since he teaches with love to the end of all the far shores of cyclic existence, he is Maitreya.

original: shes rab kyi bya ba byas na 'jam pa'i skam sar dpal gyi gnas pas na 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi bya ba byas na 'jam pa'i skam sar dpal gyi gnas pas na 'jam dpal lo //
translated: Since he is the abode of glory on the stage of the soft body when he performs the deeds of wisdom, he is Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i ye shes 'ba' zhig gi dri las byung bas thugs rje chen po'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i ye shes 'ba' zhig gi dri las byung bas thugs rje chen po'o //
translated: Since he arises only from the fragrance of the gnosis of nirvƒÅ·πáa, he is MahƒÅkƒÅru·πáika.

original: 'byung gnas khyab pas na spos kyi glang po'o //
analyzed: 'byung gnas khyab pas na spos kyi glang po'o //
translated: Since he is the source and pervades, he is Gandhahastin.

original: shes rab mtshon chen gyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis nyon mongs pa 'joms pa'i tog yin pas na ye shes tog go //
analyzed: shes rab mtshon chen gyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis nyon mongs pa 'joms pa'i tog yin pas na ye shes tog go //
translated: He is the crest-jewel of the destruction of the afflictions by the nature of the wisdom of the great weapon of wisdom.

original: dam pa'i chos bzang po'i chos kyi rgyal srid gsal bar ldan zhing skyong bas na bzang skyong ngo //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bzang po'i chos kyi rgyal srid gsal bar ldan zhing skyong bas na bzang skyong ngo //
translated: He is BhadrapƒÅla, the protector of the good, because he illuminates and protects the kingdom of the good Dharma.

original: 'khor ba 'jig rten gyi rgya mtsho blos snang bar byed pa'i mchog yin pas na blo gros rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba 'jig rten gyi rgya mtsho blos snang bar byed pa'i mchog yin pas na blo gros rgya mtsho'o //
translated: He is SƒÅgaramati, the ocean of wisdom, because he is the supreme illuminator of the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: chos kyi dbang phyug ni mi zad cing chos kyi rgyal srid ni blo dang ldan pas na blo gros mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbang phyug ni mi zad cing chos kyi rgyal srid ni blo dang ldan pas na blo gros mi zad pa'o //
translated: He is Ak·π£ayamati, the inexhaustible wisdom, because he is wise in the inexhaustible sovereignty of the Dharma.

original: ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du legs pa'i lam gyi spobs pa dang ldan zhing ston pa pos brtsegs bas na spobs pa brtsegs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du legs pa'i lam gyi spobs pa dang ldan zhing ston pa pos brtsegs bas na spobs pa brtsegs pa'o //
translated: He is PratibhƒÅnak≈´·π≠a, the heap of eloquence, because he is the teacher who possesses the eloquence of the good path according to his thoughts.

original: don grub pa chen po'i bsam pa ni blo dang ldan pas na mthu chen thob pa'o //
analyzed: don grub pa chen po'i bsam pa ni blo dang ldan pas na mthu chen thob pa'o //
translated: He is MahƒÅstattva, the attainment of great power, because he is wise in the thought of great accomplishment.

original: ngan song gi rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs nas kun 'dren zhing mi gtong bas na ngan song kun no //
analyzed: ngan song gi rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs nas kun 'dren zhing mi gtong bas na ngan song kun no //
translated: Having abandoned all thoughts of the lower realms, he is the leader of all, never abandoning them.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni mya ngan dang mun pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni mya ngan dang mun pa med pa'o //
translated: Non-conceptuality is without sorrow and darkness.

original: dbyings mi zad pa ni nges par 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: dbyings mi zad pa ni nges par 'joms pa'o //
translated: The inexhaustible realm is the destroyer of the certain.

original: chos kyi dbyings dam pa'i dran pa dang ldan zhing zad mi shes pa'i 'od mnga' bas na dra ba can gyi 'od do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dam pa'i dran pa dang ldan zhing zad mi shes pa'i 'od mnga' bas na dra ba can gyi 'od do //
translated: Endowed with the mindfulness of the holy realm of phenomena and possessing inexhaustible light, he is Jaliniprabha.

original: bsod nams dang ldan pa'i zla bas sems can tshim zhing bsod nams mchog gi sku gzhon nu mnga' bas na zla 'od gzhon nu'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ldan pa'i zla bas sems can tshim zhing bsod nams mchog gi sku gzhon nu mnga' bas na zla 'od gzhon nu'o //
translated: Satisfying sentient beings with the moon of merit and possessing the youthful body of supreme merit, he is Candraprabhakumara.

original: so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes ni 'od do //
analyzed: so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes ni 'od do //
translated: The wisdom of discernment is light.

original: ye shes 'byung gnas che ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //üîΩye shes ldan pa yod med shes ;
analyzed: ye shes 'byung gnas che ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o // ye shes ldan pa yod med shes ;
translated: The great source of wisdom is Amitabha.

original: / zhes bya ba ni yod med la khyab pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i skye gnas mnga' bas na nam mkha'i snying po'o //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni yod med la khyab pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i skye gnas mnga' bas na nam mkha'i snying po'o //
translated: Endowed with the wisdom that pervades existence and non-existence, he is Akashgarbha.

original: tshogs gnyis bsags pas tshogs gnyis kyi mthus sgrib pa thams cad sel bas na sgrib pa sel ba'o //üîΩrtag pa kun rgyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su @12a * //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis bsags pas tshogs gnyis kyi mthus sgrib pa thams cad sel bas na sgrib pa sel ba'o // rtag pa kun rgyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su @12a * //
translated: The removal of obscurations is due to the removal of all obscurations by the power of the two stores of merit and knowledge which are accumulated.

original: bcad pa gnyis kyis de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bstan te /
analyzed: bcad pa gnyis kyis de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bstan te /
translated: The two verses beginning with the eternal, the universal monarch teach the five Tathagatas.

original: rtag pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The eternal is Vairocana.

original: kun rgyal ni me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: kun rgyal ni me long lta bu'o //
translated: The universal monarch is the mirror-like (wisdom).

original: rnal 'byor can ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The yogin is the wisdom of equality.

original: bsam gtan bsam bya ni bya ba nan tan to //
analyzed: bsam gtan bsam bya ni bya ba nan tan to //
translated: The object of meditation is the wisdom of accomplishing activities.

original: blo ldan mchog ni so sor kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: blo ldan mchog ni so sor kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: The wise one is the wisdom of individual investigation.

original: so so rang rig mi g-yo ba //
analyzed: so so rang rig mi g-yo ba //
translated: The immovable is the wisdom of the essential nature.

original: mchog gi dang po zhes bya ba ni dang po'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: mchog gi dang po zhes bya ba ni dang po'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: The supreme first is the first Buddha.

original: de la dkyil 'khor drug pa la dang po'i sangs rgyas yod pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor drug pa la dang po'i sangs rgyas yod pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Therein, the immovable is the first Buddha because he exists in the six mandalas.

original: de nyid ni dang po'i sangs rgyas te mchog gi dang po'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni dang po'i sangs rgyas te mchog gi dang po'o //
translated: That very (immovable one) is the first Buddha, the supreme first.

original: so so rang rig ces bya ba ni ye shes sku ste de ni rnam par snang mdzad dang dang po'i sangs rgyas dang ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i dang / sprul pa'i sku gsum 'chang bas sku gsum 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: so so rang rig ces bya ba ni ye shes sku ste de ni rnam par snang mdzad dang dang po'i sangs rgyas dang ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i dang / sprul pa'i sku gsum 'chang bas sku gsum 'chang ba'o //
translated: The so-called self-awareness is the gnosis body, which is Vairochana, the primordial Buddha, and the nature of the gnosis body, which is the bearer of the three bodies of reality, enjoyment, and emanation.

original: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can ni rnam pa'i sgo nas me long lta bu'i ye shes te mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can ni rnam pa'i sgo nas me long lta bu'i ye shes te mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The one who has the nature of the five Buddha bodies is Akshobhya, the mirror-like gnosis in terms of aspect.

original: khyab bdag ye shes lnga'i bdag ni ye shes sems dpa'i so sor rtog pas na 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: khyab bdag ye shes lnga'i bdag ni ye shes sems dpa'i so sor rtog pas na 'od dpag tu med pa'o //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni dkar po dang sngon po dang dmar po dang ser po dang ljang gu'i sku mdog can zhal lnga pa phyag brgyad pa thams cad kyang dang po na 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang padma dang rin po che dang sna tshogs rdo rje
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni dkar po dang sngon po dang dmar po dang ser po dang ljang gu'i sku mdog can zhal lnga pa phyag brgyad pa thams cad kyang dang po na 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang padma dang rin po che dang sna tshogs rdo rje
translated: The tathƒÅgatas have bodies that are white, blue, red, yellow, and green, with five faces and eight arms. All of them hold a wheel, a vajra, a lotus, a jewel, and a crossed vajra in the first right hands.

original: ba snams pa g-yas kyi tha ma gsum thams cad ral gri bsnams pa g-yon gyi dang po thams cad rang rang gi mtshan ma dril bu bsnams pa /
analyzed: ba snams pa g-yas kyi tha ma gsum thams cad ral gri bsnams pa g-yon gyi dang po thams cad rang rang gi mtshan ma dril bu bsnams pa /
translated: The last three right hands hold a sword, and the first left hands hold a bell with their respective insignia.

original: g-yon lhag ma gsum pa thams cad glegs bam ba snams pa rnam par snang mdzad ni g-yas sngo ba rgyab dmar ba g-yon ljang ba steng ser ba'o //üîΩmi bskyod pa ni g-yas dkar ba dang rgyab dmar ba g-yon ljang ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yon lhag ma gsum pa thams cad glegs bam ba snams pa rnam par snang mdzad ni g-yas sngo ba rgyab dmar ba g-yon ljang ba steng ser ba'o // mi bskyod pa ni g-yas dkar ba dang rgyab dmar ba g-yon ljang ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: All of the remaining left hands hold a scripture. Vairocana is blue on the right, red in the back, green on the left, and yellow above.üîΩAk·π£obhya is white on the right, red in the back, green on the left, and blue above.

original: snang ba mtha' yas ni g-yas dkar ba rgyab sngo ba g-yon ljang ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas ni g-yas dkar ba rgyab sngo ba g-yon ljang ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: AmitƒÅbha is white on the right, blue in the back, green on the left, and red above.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan ni g-yas dkar ba rgyab dmar ba g-yon ljang ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan ni g-yas dkar ba rgyab dmar ba g-yon ljang ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Ratnasa·πÉbhava is white on the right, red in the back, and green on the left, as before.

original: don yod grub pa ni g-yas dkar ba rgyab dmar ba g-yon sngo ba ste ser ba'o //üîΩsangs rgyas @12b thams cad skyed pa po //
analyzed: don yod grub pa ni g-yas dkar ba rgyab dmar ba g-yon sngo ba ste ser ba'o // sangs rgyas @12b thams cad skyed pa po //
translated: Amoghasiddhi is white on the right, red in the back, and blue on the left, as before.üîΩThe two verses beginning with ‚ÄúThe producer of all buddhas‚Äù

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni 'khor los sgyur ba brgyad bstan te /
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni 'khor los sgyur ba brgyad bstan te /
translated: indicate the eight wheel-holders.

original: thams cad gser gyi mdog can g-yas na 'khor lo bsnams pa g-yon gdan la brten pa seng ge'i steng na nyi ma la rdo rje skyil mo krung rin po cha'i cod pan can no //
analyzed: thams cad gser gyi mdog can g-yas na 'khor lo bsnams pa g-yon gdan la brten pa seng ge'i steng na nyi ma la rdo rje skyil mo krung rin po cha'i cod pan can no //
translated: All of them are golden colored, holding a wheel in the right hand, resting on a seat, on a lion throne in the sun, in the vajra posture, with a jeweled crown.

original: yang dag pa'i lta bas sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pas na dang po rdo rje 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bas sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pas na dang po rdo rje 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: The first, Vajracakra, is the producer of all buddhas, because of right view.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pas sangs rgyas kyi sras po dam pa rnams skyed pas na mchog ste gnyis pa rin po che'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pas sangs rgyas kyi sras po dam pa rnams skyed pas na mchog ste gnyis pa rin po che'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: The second, Ratnasa·πÉbhava, is supreme, because of the production of the best sons of the buddhas, because of right thought.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag ni rab tu mi gnas pa'i bdag nyid shes rab sred par 'byung ba'i skye gnas med pas gsum pa padma'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag ni rab tu mi gnas pa'i bdag nyid shes rab sred par 'byung ba'i skye gnas med pas gsum pa padma'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: Right speech is the third, the lotus universal monarch, because it is the nature of non-abiding and is the source of the wisdom craving for the unborn.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' chos las byung ba'i lam gyi mya ngan las 'das pas srid pa sel bas na bzhi ba las kyi 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' chos las byung ba'i lam gyi mya ngan las 'das pas srid pa sel bas na bzhi ba las kyi 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: Right action is the fourth, the karma universal monarch, because it is the path arisen from the Dharma and eliminates existence through nirvana.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas stong pa nyid la gcig tu mkhregs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rdo rje'i bdag nyid lnga pa phyag rgya chen po'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas stong pa nyid la gcig tu mkhregs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rdo rje'i bdag nyid lnga pa phyag rgya chen po'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: Right livelihood is the fifth, the great seal universal monarch, because it is the nature of the vajra of meditative serenity and insight that is completely focused on emptiness.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas skyes ma thag tu skad cig ma la bya ba grub pa'i sprul pa 'gro ba'i bdag po drug pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol bas skyes ma thag tu skad cig ma la bya ba grub pa'i sprul pa 'gro ba'i bdag po drug pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: Right effort is the sixth, the pledge seal universal monarch, because it is the emanation that is the lord of migrating beings and accomplishes its activities in an instant upon arising.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa nam mkha' las byung ba'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i me las byung ba'i bdun pa chos kyi phyag rgya'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa nam mkha' las byung ba'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i me las byung ba'i bdun pa chos kyi phyag rgya'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: Right mindfulness is the seventh cakravartin of the dharma-mudra, who is born from the fire of natural luminosity, abiding in the signless arisen from space.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni lhag mthong shes rab ye shes kyi me chen po'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa sreg pa'i brgyad pa las kyi phyag rgya'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni lhag mthong shes rab ye shes kyi me chen po'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa sreg pa'i brgyad pa las kyi phyag rgya'i 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: Right concentration is the eighth cakravartin of the karma-mudra, who enters into the meditative absorption of the great fire of the wisdom of insight, burning the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba brgyad ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyogs bzhir gnyis gnyis bzhugs la /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba brgyad ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyogs bzhir gnyis gnyis bzhugs la /
translated: The eight cakravartins are Vairocana, who resides in the four directions with two in each direction.

original: mtshams su spyan ma la sogs pa yum bzhi dgod par bya'o //üîΩ'od chen rnam par snang bar byed ;
analyzed: mtshams su spyan ma la sogs pa yum bzhi dgod par bya'o // 'od chen rnam par snang bar byed ;
translated: The four mothers LocanƒÅ and so on are placed in the intermediate directions.

original: / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis mchod pa'i lha mo brgyad bstan te /
analyzed: / ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis mchod pa'i lha mo brgyad bstan te /
translated: The two verses beginning ‚ÄúGreat light, illuminating‚Äù teach the eight offering goddesses.

original: gzugs chen po'i 'od phun sum tshogs pa snad bar byed pa sgeg mo'o //
analyzed: gzugs chen po'i 'od phun sum tshogs pa snad bar byed pa sgeg mo'o //
translated: The goddess LƒÅsya, dance, is the radiance of the great form of light.

original: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi ye shes snang bas lham mer mdzad pas na phreng ba ma'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi ye shes snang bas lham mer mdzad pas na phreng ba ma'o //
translated: The goddess MƒÅlƒÅ, garland, is the radiance of the wisdom of pure discipline, which is the pure three spheres.

original: @13a * // 'gro ba mi 'khrugs pa'i bzed pa'i mar me ye shes kyi sgron ma glu ma'o //
analyzed: @13a * // 'gro ba mi 'khrugs pa'i bzed pa'i mar me ye shes kyi sgron ma glu ma'o //
translated: The goddess Gƒ´tƒÅ, song, is the lamp of the wisdom of the lamp of the butter-lamp of the unshakable mind of the world.

original: gzi brjid chen po'i go cha brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis le lo'i gnyen por 'od gsal ba'i phyir na gar ma'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid chen po'i go cha brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis le lo'i gnyen por 'od gsal ba'i phyir na gar ma'o //

analyzed: zhi gnas kyi sngags kyis nyon mongs pa'i dug zhi par byed pa'i rig sngags kyi rgyal mo ni bdug pa ma'o //

analyzed: sngags kyi rgyal po shes rab kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i don chen po byed pas me tog ma'o //

original: gtsug tor chen po'i thabs dang stobs kyis rmad du byung ba'i zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga'i gtsug tor mnga' bas na dri chab ma'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor chen po'i thabs dang stobs kyis rmad du byung ba'i zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga'i gtsug tor mnga' bas na dri chab ma'o //
translated: The goddess GandhƒÅ, perfume, is the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a of the five excellent and uncontaminated aggregates through the method and power of the great u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a.

original: smon lam gyi stobs kyis gzugs sna tshogs ston pa dang ye shes kyi nam mkha'i bdag po mdzad pas na mar me ma'o //
analyzed: smon lam gyi stobs kyis gzugs sna tshogs ston pa dang ye shes kyi nam mkha'i bdag po mdzad pas na mar me ma'o //
translated: Since he displays various forms by the power of his vows and acts as the lord of the sky of intuition, he is the Lamp.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku bsgom pa'i dad pa'i mchog ste rdo rje lcags kyu ni dkar po rdo rje lcags kyu bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku bsgom pa'i dad pa'i mchog ste rdo rje lcags kyu ni dkar po rdo rje lcags kyu bsnams pa'o //
translated: The supreme faith of meditating on the body of all buddhas, the white Vajra Hook, holds a hook.

original: kun du dga' ba'i brtson 'grus kyi mig dang ldan pas rdo rje zhags pa ni ser po zhags pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: kun du dga' ba'i brtson 'grus kyi mig dang ldan pas rdo rje zhags pa ni ser po zhags pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: Since he has the eye of the diligence of universal joy, the yellow Vajra noose holds a noose.

original: sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can dran pa'i dbang pos 'gro ba la phan pa bskyed pa rdo rje lcags sgrog bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can dran pa'i dbang pos 'gro ba la phan pa bskyed pa rdo rje lcags sgrog bsnams pa'o //
translated: Having a variety of forms, he generates benefit for beings with the power of memory, holding a vajra chain.

original: shes rab kyi dbang pos mchod cing bstod de ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos drang srong chen por gyur pa ni rdo rje 'bebs pa ljang gu ste dril bu bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang pos mchod cing bstod de ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos drang srong chen por gyur pa ni rdo rje 'bebs pa ljang gu ste dril bu bsnams pa'o //
translated: Having the power of wisdom, he is praised and extolled, and with the power of samadhi he becomes a great sage, the green Vajra A vesa, holding a bell.

original: shlo ka nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor bstan te /
analyzed: shlo ka nyi shu rtsa gsum gyis rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor bstan te /

original: shes rab ye shes lus 'chang ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'khor los sgyur ba'o /
analyzed: shes rab ye shes lus 'chang ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'khor los sgyur ba'o /

original: // / da ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas bstod par bzhed pas /
analyzed: // / da ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas bstod par bzhed pas /
translated: Now, intending to praise from the perspective of the mandala of Vajra Humkara,

original: rigs gsum 'chang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs gsum 'chang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he declares ‚Äúthe one who holds the three families,‚Äù and so on.

original: dang po'i tshigs bcad gcig gis rnam par snang mdzad ston pa la /
analyzed: dang po'i tshigs bcad gcig gis rnam par snang mdzad ston pa la /

original: rigs gsum 'chang ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi yin tan no / gsang sngags can ni don yod grub pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: rigs gsum 'chang ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi yin tan no / gsang sngags can ni don yod grub pa'i yon tan no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who holds the three families‚Äù is the quality of Ratnasambhava; ‚Äúthe one with mantra‚Äù is the quality of Amoghasiddhi;

original: dam tshig chen po ni mi bskyod pa'i'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po ni mi bskyod pa'i'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe one with great commitment‚Äù is Akshobhya‚Äôs;

analyzed: gsang sngags 'chang ba ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe one with mantra‚Äù is Amitabha‚Äôs;

original: gtso bo ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: gtso bo ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: ‚Äúthe chief‚Äù is Vairochana.

original: rang dang po'i sangs rgyas dang ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang po'i sangs rgyas dang ye shes kyi sku'i bdag nyid dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He is the holder of the three jewels, the nature of the original buddha and the body of wisdom.

original: theg pa mchog gsum ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po gsum ston pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa mchog gsum ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po gsum ston pa'o //

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi @13b dbang du byas na /
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi @13b dbang du byas na /
translated: If one takes the case of Vajra Humkara,

original: don yod zhags pa ni mda' dang gzhu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: don yod zhags pa ni mda' dang gzhu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Amogha-pasa holds a bow and arrow.

original: rnam par rgyal ba ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgyas rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgyas rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Vijaya holds a vajra and bell in the gesture of total victory over the three worlds.

original: 'dzin pa chen po ni ral gri'i yu ba 'dzin pas na ral gri bsnams pa'o //üîΩrdo rje zhags pa ni zhags ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa chen po ni ral gri'i yu ba 'dzin pas na ral gri bsnams pa'o // rdo rje zhags pa ni zhags ba nyid do //

original: rdo rje lcags kyu ni lcags kyu nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu ni lcags kyu nyid do //

original: zhags pa chen po ni lcags sgrog go //
analyzed: zhags pa chen po ni lcags sgrog go //

original: rdo rje 'jigs byed ni dbang phyug chen pho dang au ma 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jigs byed ni dbang phyug chen pho dang au ma 'jigs par byed pa'o //

original: rin chen h'um mdzad bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rin chen h'um mdzad bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of Ratna-humkara is as follows.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po gdong drug 'jigs ni mdog ser po mig drug ni spyan drug tshan gsum mo //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po gdong drug 'jigs ni mdog ser po mig drug ni spyan drug tshan gsum mo //
translated: The king of wrathful ones, the terrible six-faced one, is yellow in color and has six eyes, that is, three sets of two eyes.

original: lag drug stobs dang ldan pa ni 'jig rten gsum las rgyal ba'i phyag rgya spangs pa'i snga ma drug go //
analyzed: lag drug stobs dang ldan pa ni 'jig rten gsum las rgyal ba'i phyag rgya spangs pa'i snga ma drug go //

original: padma h'um mdzad bshad pa ni /
analyzed: padma h'um mdzad bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of Padma Humkara:

original: keng rus mche ba gtsigs pa po ste keng rus ltar mche ba gtsigs pa'o //
analyzed: keng rus mche ba gtsigs pa po ste keng rus ltar mche ba gtsigs pa'o //

analyzed: ha la ha la ni dug nag po brtsegs pas mgrin pa sngon po'o //

original: las kyi h'um mdzad bshad pa /
analyzed: las kyi h'um mdzad bshad pa /

analyzed: ral gri dang gtun shing dang lcags kyu dang zhags pa bsnams pa /

analyzed: / snying po ni skye gnas te rdo rje rin chen ma'o //

analyzed: smon pa med pa'i sgyu 'phrul ni rdo rje chos ma'o //

analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa'i gos su mnabs shing so'i phreng ba 'chang ba'o //

original: las kyi h'um mdzad kyi 'khor bshad pa /üîΩsbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi ha ha zhes sgrogs pa ni rdo rje las so //
analyzed: las kyi h'um mdzad kyi 'khor bshad pa / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi ha ha zhes sgrogs pa ni rdo rje las so //
translated: The retinue of Karma-Humkara is explained:üîΩThe one who proclaims ha ha with the striving of application is Vajra-Karma.

analyzed: rdo rje gad mo cher sgrogs pas na rdo rje khu tshur ro //

analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi 'khor bshad pa ni /
translated: The retinue of Vajra-Humkara is explained:

original: rdo rje sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' sems dpa' che //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' nyid do //

analyzed: rdo rje rgyal po bde ba che ni rdo rje rgyal po nyid do //
translated: Vajraraja, great bliss, is Vajraraja himself.

analyzed: rdo rje drag po dga' ba che ni chags pa yin pas rdo rje chags pa'o //

analyzed: rdo rje spro ba ni h'um ste h'um gi sgra sgrogs pa ni rdo rje legs pa'o //
translated: Vajra-Excitement is H≈™·πÄ, and since it proclaims the sound of H≈™·πÄ, it is Vajra-Well-Gone.

original: chos kyi h'um mdzad kyi 'khor bshad pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi h'um mdzad kyi 'khor bshad pa ni /
translated: The retinue of Dharma H≈™·πÄ-KƒÄRA is explained:

original: mtshon du rdo rje'i mda' thogs pa ni padma'i mda' dang gzhu thogs pa'i rdo rje chos so //
analyzed: mtshon du rdo rje'i mda' thogs pa ni padma'i mda' dang gzhu thogs pa'i rdo rje chos so //
translated: Vajra-Dharma holds a lotus arrow and bow, since he holds a vajra arrow and a lotus bow.

original: rdo rje ral gris ma lus gcod ni rdo rje rnon po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ral gris ma lus gcod ni rdo rje rnon po'o //
translated: Vajra-Sharpness is the one who cuts everything with a vajra sword.

original: rdo rje kun 'chang ni rdzu 'phrul gyis kun du spro ba'i rdo rje 'chang bas na rdo rje 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: rdo rje kun 'chang ni rdzu 'phrul gyis kun du spro ba'i rdo rje 'chang bas na rdo rje 'khor lo'o //
translated: Vajra-Wheel holds a vajra that radiates everywhere by means of magical emanations.

original: rdo rje gcig pus lce la mtshan pa so so yang dag par rig pas pha rol gyi g-yul sel bas na rdo rje smra ba'o //üîΩrdo rje lcags kyu 'bar ba dang mig mi bzad pa 'chang bas na rdo rje lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gcig pus lce la mtshan pa so so yang dag par rig pas pha rol gyi g-yul sel bas na rdo rje smra ba'o // rdo rje lcags kyu 'bar ba dang mig mi bzad pa 'chang bas na rdo rje lcags kyu'o //
translated: Vajra-Speech is the one who conquers the enemy of the discriminations by means of the single vajra that is marked on the tongue.üîΩVajra-Hook holds a blazing vajra hook and an unbearable eye.

original: skra yang rdo rje 'bar bas zhags pa'o //
analyzed: skra yang rdo rje 'bar bas zhags pa'o //
translated: Vajra-Noose is the one with hair that is a blazing vajra noose.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mig brgya mnga' zhing mngon par shes pa drug gi rdo rje'i mig mnga' bas na lcags sgrog go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mig brgya mnga' zhing mngon par shes pa drug gi rdo rje'i mig mnga' bas na lcags sgrog go //
translated: Since he has the eye of meditative concentration and the vajra eye of the six superknowledges, he is the iron hook.

original: rdo rje 'bebs pa 'bebs pa che ni rdo rje 'bebs pa'o ;üîΩ/ las ni rdo rje'i ba spu can //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bebs pa 'bebs pa che ni rdo rje 'bebs pa'o ; / las ni rdo rje'i ba spu can //
translated: The great descent of vajra descent is vajra descent.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis mchod pa'i lha mo ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis mchod pa'i lha mo ston te /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúAction, vajra-haired‚Äù indicates the goddesses of offering.

original: sbyin pa la sbyor ba bstan pas rdo rje bzhin du /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sbyor ba bstan pas rdo rje bzhin du /
translated: Since he is applied to generosity, he is like a vajra.

original: lus ni rdo rje'i ba spu can ni sgeg mo'o //
analyzed: lus ni rdo rje'i ba spu can ni sgeg mo'o //
translated: His body is vajra-haired, that is, he is the goddess Charm.

original: tshul khrims la sbyor ba mi phyed pas rdo rje'i ba spu ste gcig pu lus kyi phreng ba ma'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sbyor ba mi phyed pas rdo rje'i ba spu ste gcig pu lus kyi phreng ba ma'o //
translated: Since he is applied to morality, he is vajra-haired, that is, he is the goddess Garland, who has a single body.

original: bzod pa la mi phyed pas na sen mo skyes pa rdo rje rdo rje glu ma'o //üîΩbrtson 'grus la mi phyed pa'i sbyor ba /
analyzed: bzod pa la mi phyed pas na sen mo skyes pa rdo rje rdo rje glu ma'o // brtson 'grus la mi phyed pa'i sbyor ba /
translated: Since he is applied to patience, he is vajra-haired, that is, he is the goddess Song, who has vajra nails.

original: rdo rje snying po pags pa mkhregs te rdo rje gar ma'o //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po pags pa mkhregs te rdo rje gar ma'o //
translated: Since he is applied to effort, he is vajra-haired, that is, he is the goddess Dance, who has a vajra essence and tough skin.

original: zhi gnas kyi bsam gtan gyi rdo rje phreng ba thogs shing zung du 'jug pa'i dpal dang ldan pas bdug pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi bsam gtan gyi rdo rje phreng ba thogs shing zung du 'jug pa'i dpal dang ldan pas bdug pa'o //
translated: She is perfumed with the glory of the union of the vajra and the rosary of meditative stabilizations of serenity.

translated: She is the flower-bearer, adorned with the ornament of just the insight.üîΩShe is the vajra lamp, proclaiming the laughter of the display of power.üîΩShe is the vajra incense, sounding the vajra sound of the indivisible aspiration, ‚ÄúOm!
